key_events: Artie smoothed and fed the Crumpled Dollar Bill into the Snack-o-Matic 3000 after several failed attempts.
The machine jammed on the last bag of Cool Ranch chips, leaving them dangling over the drop zone.
Artie shook the machine to dislodge the snack, triggering a high-pitched electronic whine and a massive discharge.
A blue arc of electricity struck Artie in the chest, using his Corporate ID Badge as a lightning rod.
Artie died instantly, his consciousness flickering as reality stability dropped to 99%.
The bag of chips fell onto Artie's chest after his death.
Artie identifies the 'Bonus Anomaly Pool' of 50 points.
Artie allocates all 10 standard points and 50 bonus points into Critical Hit Rate.
The System triggers the 'Glass Soul' condition, locking Artie's HP at 1/1.
Artie's Crit Rate is set to 100% and he unlocks the 'Crit or Quit' title.
The System Void dissolves and transitions into the Slime Fields tutorial zone.
Artie and Fizz transitioned from the System Void to the Slime Fields.
Artie confirmed his mundane office items (ID, Smartphone, Wallet) survived the transition.
Artie viewed his status screen, confirming Level 1 and the permanent Glass Soul lock.
A Level 1 Lesser Green Slime aggroed on Artie and initiated combat.
Artie narrowly avoided a 'Tutorial Bounce' attack, passing a minor durability check upon landing.
Artie was cornered by the slime's 'Tutorial Slam' attack with no weapon to defend himself.
Artie missed five consecutive attacks against a Level 1 Slime due to poor form.
Artie triggered a massive overkill critical hit on his sixth attempt with a pathetic shove.
The critical hit vaporized a Lesser Green Slime and disintegrated a nearby environmental oak tree.
Artie leveled up to Level 2 and received a system warning about environmental damage.
Artie made progress toward the 'One-Hit Wonder' title (1/10).
Artie acquired the ITEM_PARTICIPATION_TROPHY, which is soul-bound and cursed with the 'Beacon of Trash' effect.
Artie reached Level 3, though his 5 new stat points are being held for verification by the System.
The 'Beacon of Trash' effect triggered a zone-wide aggro event, drawing thousands of slimes toward Artie.
Artie's stamina depleted to 45/100 as he began a desperate sprint toward the Oakhaven gate.
The System Administrator mocked Artie's request for a manager through a UI notification.
Artie entered the Oakhaven Safe Zone, successfully resetting the 'Beacon of Trash' aggro event.
Artie's stamina dropped to a critical 2/100 during the desperate flight from the tutorial zone.
The Oakhaven Gatekeeper Scan identified Artie's 'Crit or Quit' build as a high-variance anomaly.
Gate guards detained Artie under suspicion of 'glitching' the system after the scanner turned violet.
Artie confirmed his mundane belongings (Smartphone, Wallet, ID) survived the transition to the hub.
Artie arrived at Barnaby's tavern and consumed a drink to recover stamina to 10/100.
Barnaby appraised Artie's stats, confirming the 100% Crit Rate and 1 HP anomaly.
Barnaby explained the political and economic value of Critical Hits in Oakhaven's society.
Artie realized his presence was logged in the city's census, making him a target for 'talent scouts'.
Artie's title progress for 'One-Hit Wonder' increased to 2/10.
Vane's Aura of Intimidation (Rank B) drained Artie's stamina from 10 to 4.
Vane identified Artie's 1 HP 'Glass Soul' status and 100% Crit Rate.
The System issued a Formal Duel Request from Vane to Artie with ownership stakes.
Artie successfully distracted Vane with a fake UI alert and fled the tavern.
